=== 1     Introduction ===
The main mission of Ubuntu-tn team is to spread Ubuntu use in Tunisia. To achieve this mission, the Ubuntu LoCo team-tn tends to organize regular Classroom sessions. The first Classroom was proposed and led by Zied Abid on 8th of may 2009 about the use of Bazaar. The goal of this session was to introduce
versioning tools to Ubuntu-tn members taking as example Bazaar.
=== 2     Classroom context ===
   • IRC Channel: ubuntu-tn-classroom under irc.freenode.net
   • Event date: 8 May 2009
   • Event time: from 21:00 to 01:00
   • Event organizer: Ubuntu-tn
   • Animator: Zied Abid
   • Theme: Versioning tools, exple Bazaar
   • Log file: <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TunisianTeam/Classroom/Bazaar#The%20LOG|LOG]]</nowiki>
=== 3     Outline of the classroom ===
   • 1) Introduction
         – 1.1) Introduction to Bazaar
         – 1.2) Introduction to versioning tools
         – 1.3) Different use cases of Bazaar
         – 1.4) Documentation
   • A - Centralized collaborative work
   • 2) Tools
         – 2.1) Graphical tools: Olive, bazaar Notifier, branch graph
         – 2.2) Launchpad
         – 2.3) Getting prepared: Launchpad account + ssh Key
                                        1
    • 3) First commands
         – 3.1) minimal use
              ∗ 3.1.1) Checkout
              ∗ 3.1.2) modification
              ∗ 3.1.3) Diff
              ∗ 3.1.4) update
              ∗ 3.1.4) commit (Message, Editor, Mail)
         – 3.2) Conflict resolution
              ∗ 3.2.1) Diff and correction
              ∗ 3.2.2) resolve
    • 4) Other commands
         – 4.1) add, remove, mv, status
         – 4.2) log
         – 4.3) repository or ”init-repository” creation
    • 5) Advanced commands
    • A - Decentralized collaborative work
    • 6) Introduction to different decentralized collaborative work with Bazaar
=== 4     Exercises ===
TO BE FILLED BY THE ORGANISER
=== 5     Attendees ===
EACH MEMBER HAS TO ADD HIS NAME FOLLOWED BY HIS NICK-
NAME
    • Wassim Derguech (derwas)
=== 6     Acknowledgements ===
A big thank to our first classroom animator Zied Abid for his voluntary spirit in proposing and organizing such activity. We want also to thank all attendees for their presence, interaction, respect...
                                         
=== 7     Conclusion ===
This classroom was a first opportunity for all members to attend such tutorials.
Different users were involved with different levels from beginners to advanced
users. Many questions were asked, Zied and some others were in geat help. This
first session was not enough to have a global clear idea about the use of Bazaar
and attendees asked for other sessions and Zied agreed for that.
